act:
949048 THE WEST GODAVARI DISTRICT (ASSIMILATION OF LAWS ON FEDERAL SUBJECTS) ACT, 1949
ACT NO. 20 OF 1949 [ 14th April, 1949.] An Act to assimilate certain laws in force in different parts of the West Godavari District of the Province of Madras.
WHEREAS by virtue of the Madras Partially Excluded Area (Cesser) Order, 1948, made under section 91 of the Government of India Act, 1935, the area comprised in the villages specified in Article 2 of the said Order ceased, as from the 1st day of July, 1948, to be part of a partially excluded area in the West Godavari district of the Province of Madras;
AND WHEREAS it is expedient that the laws in force in the said area with respect to the matters enumerated in List I in the Seventh Schedule to the Government of India Act, 1935, (25 and 26 Geo. 5, c. 2.) should be assimilated to the laws in force with respect to the said matters in the rest of the said district;
It is hereby enacted as follows:--
1425718 1 Short title and commencement.
1634026 1This Act may be called the West Godavari District (Assimilation of Laws on Federal Subjects) Act, 1949.
1737394 2It shall come into force on such date 1 as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, appoint.
294568 2 Interpretation. In this Act--
1897992 a" appointed day" means the date appointed under sub- section (2) of section 1 for the coming into force of this Act;
907876 b" Eluru Taluk" means the taluk of that name in the West Godavari district of the State of Madras;
96778 c" law" means any Act, Ordinance, Regulation, rule, order or bye- law, relating to any of the matters enumerated in List I in the Seventh Schedule to the Government of India Act, 1935 (25 and 26 Geo. 5, c. 2); and
60292 d" scheduled area" means the area comprised in the villages which are specified in the Schedule to this Act.
684597 3 Assimilation of laws.
942303 1All laws which immediately before the appointed day extend to, or are in force in, the Eluru Taluk, but not in the scheduled 112 1Ist July, 1949, Gazette of India, 1949, Extraordinary, p. 1085.
area, shall, as from that day, extend to, or as the case may be, come into force in, the scheduled area.
1252398 2All laws which immediately before the appointed day are in force in the scheduled area, but not in the Eluru Taluk, shall on that day cease to be in force in the scheduled area, except as respects things done or omitted to be done before that day.
1224156 4Provision for removal of difficulties. If any difficulty arises in relation to the transition from the laws mentioned in sub- section (2) of section 3 to the laws mentioned in sub- section 1 thereof, the Central Government may, by order notified in the Official Gazette, make such provision as it considers necessary for the removal of such difficulty.
